p: CoVs replication only occurs in the cytoplasm. As show in Fig.Â 1B, virus binds to its receptor angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 (ACE2) (SARS-CoV-2, SARS-CoV, and HCoV-NL63), dipeptidyl peptidase-4 (DPP4) (MERS-CoV), 9-O-Acetylated sialic acid (HCoV-OC43), or human aminopeptidase N (CD13) (HCoV-229E) [ 14], and entry into the cell by direct membrane fusion or endocytosis, in which the virus membrane fusing with cell membrane or endosome membrane and releasing viral RNA, then the virus positive-sense RNA was used as a template to synthesize negative-sense genomic RNA, this was template again to transcript mRNAs and also to replicate progeny positive-sense RNA. Viral proteins were translated by mRNAs through the endoplasmic reticulum and Golgi apparatus system for packaging into mature viral particles with the progeny RNA in the cytoplasm. Then the virions was transported to cell membrane and released by exocytosis [ 7, 15].
